metadata.title: CVE-2020-8835 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel 5.5.0 and newer, the bpf verifier(kernel/bpf/verifier.c) did not properly restrict the register bounds for32-bit operations, leading to out-of-bounds reads and writes in kernelmemory. The vulnerability also affects the Linux 5.4 stable series,starting with v5.4.7, as the introducing commit was backported to thatbranch. This vulnerability was fixed in 5.6.1, 5.5.14, and 5.4.29. (issueis aka ZDI-CAN-10780)

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
